CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice with call for competition
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C01

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS Northern, Eastern and Western Devon Clinical Commissioning Group

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: NHS Northern, Eastern and Western Devon Clinical Commissioning Group
ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: Newcourt House, Newcourt Drive, Old Rydon Lane
ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.CONTACT_POINT: Suzanne Kay, Contracts Manager, NHS Northern, Eastern and Western Devon Clinical Commissioning Group

TITLE.P: Procurement of Investor and Provider for Alcohol Outcomes Based Commissioning Demonstrator (Social Impact Bond)

SHORT_DESCR.P: The CCG is looking for expressions of interest from Investors and Providers (joint or separately) for this Devon procurement to support individuals aged between 35 and 64. The service will be delivered to achieve specific outcome metrics including reduction in secondary care costs. The Big Lottery will contribute a proportion of the funding for the achievement of outcomes via a grant offer through the Commissioning Better Outcomes Fund.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: One contract covering both lots may be awarded at the CCGs discretion.

SHORT_DESCR.P: NHS NEW Devon CCG is looking for expressions of interest from potential investors and providers. It is the CCGs intention to use a competitive dialogue procedure. The CCG intends to invite investors and providers to bid either separately or together and to develop an intervention aimed at meeting specific outcomes linked to secondary care cost reduction and individual outcomes. Detail will be agreed during the competitive dialogue process depending on the intervention(s) proposed.
Lot 1: Investor.
Lot 2: Provider.
As a minimum, outcome measures may include:
1) Reduced A&E attendances for the defined cohort of patients for the period of the project measured annually
2) Reduced emergency admissions for the defined cohort of patients for the period of the project measured annually
3) Improvement in the quality of life measure for individuals as measured at the start and end of the defined intervention
Market Engagement Event:

As part of this exercise, there will be a market engagement and design workshop event on 25.4.2018. This will be held in Devon. Bidders are not required to attend, but should you wish to attend please contact Suzie.kay@nhs.net to register your interest and receive further information. The closing date for requests to attend the event is 12:00 midday on 23.4.2018.

This will be an opportunity for any potential investors and providers to inform the future direction of this project in Devon. Materials and outcomes of the event will be available to all who request them regardless of attendance at the event or not.
The estimated value of the contract is 657 665 GBP in total for the full duration of the contract*, of which:
37 226 GBP is the expected return on investment for Lot 1.
And.
620 439 GBP is the expected payment made by the Investor to Provider.

*Payment to the Investor will be linked to achievement of outcomes, so the above figure is the expected likely value payable by the CCGs and Big Lottery grant combined if all outcomes are demonstrably achieved.
For further information on Social Impact Bonds please see:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/social-impact-bonds

INFO_ADD.P: This notice is an information gathering exercise rather than a call for competition in its own right, and therefore publication or response does not commit NHS Northern, Eastern and Western Clinical Commissioning Group or respondents to a future procurement, nor provide any process exemptions or preferential treatment to any parties expressing an interest. NHS Northern, Eastern and Western Clinical Commissioning Group will not be liable for costs incurred by any interested party in participating in this exercise.
Interested providers will be able to view this engagement notice via the 'current tenders' list on in-tend. https://in-tendhost.co.uk/scwcsu/aspx/Home
On registration, please include at least two contacts to allow for access to the portal in times of absence.

The services are healthcare services falling within Schedule 3 to the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 ("the Regulations") which are not subject to the full regime of the Regulations, but is instead governed by the "Light Touch Regime" contained within Chapter 3, Section 7 of the Regulations (Regulations 74 to 77).

The tendering process will be conducted in accordance with the requirements and flexibilities provided by Articles 74 to 76 of the Directive, and Regulations 74 to 76 of the Regulations. The Authority will run a transparent tender process, treating all Bidders equally. For the avoidance of doubt, the Authority will not be bound by the Regulations or the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union or any other regulations or legislation except for the specific parts or circumstances that apply to the procurement of these Services.

Neither the inclusion of a Bidder selection stage, nor the use of any language or terms found in the Directive or Regulations, nor the description of the procedure voluntarily adopted by the Authority ("Open", "Restricted", "Competitive Procedure with Negotiation", "Competitive Dialogue" or any other description), nor any other indication, shall be taken to mean that the Authority intends to hold itself bound by the Directive or Regulations, save by the provisions applicable to services coming within the scope of Annex XIV of the Directive / Schedule 3 of the Regulations.

The Contracting Authority intends to voluntarily observe the award decision notices provisions and 10 day standstill period described in Regulation 86 of the Regulations. Unsuccessful Bidders will receive scores and reasons for the decision, including the characteristics and relative advantages of the winning bid and the reasons why the Bidder/application was unsuccessful. Deadline for lodging of appeals should be in accordance with Regulation 87 and Regulation 91 of the Regulations.
